content:
Hello there We have read the question We try to help


Ads and commercials on the desktop screen won t stop in the Thunderbird software when it s on .

Ads or commercials in the software can be there at moments , repeatly showing ads or commercials in strokes or pop ups are common things if they are there. Antivirus software the use of it is firewall and anti phishing software is mostly in this case the stopper of these adds and bad messages. Try to u use a anti malware software , install it and repeatly delete and reinstall Thunderbird for a moment. Refresh the windows or Mac operating system and use a good antivirus and use it s tools.

Browsers have there own security field in it somehow try to search for options in there program ,the forced options are available to block certain malware.(Adblock ,turns out and delete unwanted email ads). Some time the status of a computer tells you what is running on the desktop and also tells if there are suddenly popping up commercials and ads on the screen ,what kind of pc there is and with what kind of network connection is on there, is and what kind of security options are there onboard of that system that counts and on that moment, then try to remove it from that pc with the recommended sort of software .


Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
Please describe your problem and I will attempt to assist. I am enclosing normal steps for moving a default setup:

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content:
L'impostazione dovrebbe salvarsi automaticamente. Se Thunderbird non salva le impostazione, è probabile che ci sia un problema in qualche file di configurazione che può essere bloccato (per esempio dall'antivirus) o danneggiato.

Come primo tentativo prova a cambiare l'impostazione con Thunderbird in Modalità risoluzione dei problemi -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/modalita-risoluzione-problemi-thunderbird
creator: @next

content:
Thunderbird does not keep a copy of the Master (Primary) password. If you have forgotten it, the following steps should work. All account passwords will then need to be reentered. 

Choose Tools -> Developer Tools > Error Console, paste the expression:

openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml") 

  and press the Evaluate button. That will open a dialog asking you if you want to reset your password. If Evaluate is not seen, press enter key. When prompted, press the Reset button.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password#w_resetting-your-primary-password-if-you-have-forgotten-it
creator: davidsk
